trans-unit.source: Represents a provider-independent service API for geospatial (Geometry/Geography) type support.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbSpatialServices"></xref> class.
Gets the well-known binary representation of the given <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value.
The geography value for which the well-known binary should be generated.
The well-known binary representation of the given <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value.
Gets the well-known binary representation of the given <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeometry"></xref> value.
The geometry value for which the well-known binary should be generated.
The well-known binary representation of the given <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value.
Generates the Geography Markup Language (GML) representation of this <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value.
The geography value for which the GML should be generated.
A string containing the GML representation of this DbGeography value.
Generates the Geography Markup Language (GML) representation of this <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeometry"></xref> value.
The geometry value for which the GML should be generated.
A string containing the GML representation of this DbGeometry value.
Gets the well-known text representation of the given <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value.
This value should include only the Longitude and Latitude of points.
The geography value for which the well-known text should be generated.
A string containing the well-known text representation of geographyValue.
Gets the well-known text representation of the given <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeometry"></xref> value, including only X and Y coordinates for points.
The geometry value for which the well-known text should be generated.
A string containing the well-known text representation of geometryValue.
Returns a text representation of <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbSpatialServices"></xref> with elevation and measure.
The geography value.
A text representation of <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbSpatialServices"></xref>.
Returns a text representation of <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbSpatialServices"></xref> with elevation and measure.
The geometry value.
A text representation of <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbSpatialServices"></xref> with elevation and measure.
Creates a geography value representing all points less than or equal to distance from the given value.
The geography value.
A double value specifying how far from geographyValue to buffer.
A new DbGeography value representing all points less than or equal to distance from geographyValue.
Creates a geometry value representing all points less than or equal to distance from the given value.
The geometry value.
A double value specifying how far from geometryValue to buffer.
A new DbGeometry value representing all points less than or equal to distance from geometryValue.
Determines whether one <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeometry"></xref> value spatially contains the other.
The first geometry value.
The second geometry value.
`true` if geometryValue contains otherGeometry; otherwise `false`.

This method is intended for use by derived implementations of <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbSpatialServices.GeographyFromProviderValue(System.Object)"></xref> after suitable validation of the specified provider value to ensure it is suitable for use with the derived implementation.
The spatial services instance that the returned <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value will depend on for its implementation of spatial functionality.
The provider value.
A new instance that contains the specified providerValue and uses the specified spatialServices as its spatial implementation.

This method is intended for use by derived implementations of <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbSpatialServices.GeometryFromProviderValue(System.Object)"></xref> after suitable validation of the specified provider value to ensure it is suitable for use with the derived implementation.
The spatial services instance that the returned <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeometry"></xref> value will depend on for its implementation of spatial functionality.
A provider value.
A new instance that contains the specified providerValue and uses the specified spatialServices as its spatial implementation.
Creates a provider-specific value compatible with this spatial services implementation based on the specified well-known <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeometry"></xref> representation.
An instance of <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeometryWellKnownValue"></xref> that contains the well-known representation of a geometry value.
A provider-specific value that encodes the information contained in wellKnownValue in a fashion compatible with this spatial services implementation.
Creates a provider-specific value compatible with this spatial services implementation based on the specified well-known <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> representation.
An instance of <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeographyWellKnownValue"></xref> that contains the well-known representation of a geography value.
A provider-specific value that encodes the information contained in wellKnownValue in a fashion compatible with this spatial services implementation.

Creates an instance of <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeographyWellKnownValue"></xref> that represents the specified <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value using one or both of the standard well-known spatial formats.
The geography value.
The well-known representation of geographyValue, as a new .

Creates an instance of <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeometryWellKnownValue"></xref> that represents the specified <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeometry"></xref> value using one or both of the standard well-known spatial formats.
The geometry value.
The well-known representation of geometryValue, as a new .
Determines whether the two given <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeometry"></xref> values spatially cross.
The first geometry value.
The second geometry value.
`true` if geometryValue crosses otherGeometry; otherwise `false`.
Gets the default services for the <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbSpatialServices"></xref>.
The default services.
Computes the difference of two <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> values.
The first geography value.
The second geography value.
A new DbGeography value representing the difference of geographyValue and otherGeography.
Computes the difference between two <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeometry"></xref> values.
The first geometry value.
The second geometry value.
A new DbGeometry value representing the difference between geometryValue and otherGeometry.
Determines whether the two given <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> values are spatially disjoint.
The first geography value to compare for disjointness.
The second geography value to compare for disjointness.
`true` if geographyValue is disjoint from otherGeography; otherwise `false`.
Determines whether the two given <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeometry"></xref> values are spatially disjoint.
The first geometry value to compare for disjointness.
The second geometry value to compare for disjointness.
`true` if geometryValue is disjoint from otherGeometry; otherwise `false`.
Computes the distance between the closest points in two <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> values.
The first geography value.
The second geography value.
A double value that specifies the distance between the two closest points in geographyValue and otherGeography.
Computes the distance between the closest points in two <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeometry"></xref> values.
The first geometry value.
The second geometry value.
A double value that specifies the distance between the two closest points in geometryValue and otherGeometry.
Returns an element of the given <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value, if it represents a geography collection.
The geography value, which need not represent a geography collection.
The position within the geography value from which the element should be taken.
The element in geographyValue at position index, if it represents a collection of other geography values; otherwise `null`.
Returns an element of the given <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeometry"></xref> value, if it represents a geometry collection.
The geometry value, which need not represent a geometry collection.
The position within the geometry value from which the element should be taken.
The element in geometryValue at position index, if it represents a collection of other geometry values; otherwise `null`.
Creates a new <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> collection value based on the specified well-known binary value and coordinate system identifier (SRID).
A byte array that contains a well-known binary representation of the geography value.
The identifier of the coordinate system that the new <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value should use.

A new <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value as defined by the well-known binary value with the specified coordinate system identifier (SRID) (<xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography.DefaultCoordinateSystemId"></xref>).
Creates a new <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> collection value based on the specified well-known text value and coordinate system identifier (SRID).
A string that contains a well-known text representation of the geography value.
The identifier of the coordinate system that the new <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value should use.

A new <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value as defined by the well-known text value with the specified coordinate system identifier (SRID) (<xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography.DefaultCoordinateSystemId"></xref>).
Creates a new <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value based on the specified well-known binary value and coordinate system identifier (SRID).
A byte array that contains a well-known binary representation of the geography value.
The identifier of the coordinate system that the new <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value should use.

A new <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value as defined by the well-known binary value with the specified coordinate system identifier (SRID) (<xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography.DefaultCoordinateSystemId"></xref>).
Creates a new <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value based on the specified well-known binary value.
A byte array that contains a well-known binary representation of the geography value.

A new <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value as defined by the well-known binary value with the default <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> coordinate system identifier (SRID) (<xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography.DefaultCoordinateSystemId"></xref>).
Creates a new <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value based on the specified Geography Markup Language (GML) value.
A string that contains a Geometry Markup Language (GML) representation of the geography value.

A new <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value as defined by the GML value with the default <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> coordinate system identifier (SRID) (<xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography.DefaultCoordinateSystemId"></xref>).
Creates a new <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value based on the specified Geography Markup Language (GML) value and coordinate system identifier (SRID).
A string that contains a Geometry Markup Language (GML) representation of the geography value.
The identifier of the coordinate system that the new <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value should use.
A new <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value as defined by the GML value with the specified coordinate system identifier (SRID).
Creates a new <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value based on a provider-specific value that is compatible with this spatial services implementation.
A provider-specific value that this spatial services implementation is capable of interpreting as a geography value.
A new <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value backed by this spatial services implementation and the specified provider value.
Creates a new <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value based on the specified well-known text value.
A string that contains a well-known text representation of the geography value.

A new <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value as defined by the well-known text value with the default <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> coordinate system identifier (SRID) (<xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography.DefaultCoordinateSystemId"></xref>).
Creates a new <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value based on the specified well-known text value and coordinate system identifier (SRID).
A string that contains a well-known text representation of the geography value.
The identifier of the coordinate system that the new <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value should use.

A new <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value as defined by the well-known text value with the specified coordinate system identifier (SRID) (<xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography.DefaultCoordinateSystemId"></xref>).
Creates a new <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> line value based on the specified well-known binary value and coordinate system identifier (SRID).
A byte array that contains a well-known binary representation of the geography value.
The identifier of the coordinate system that the new <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value should use.

A new <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value as defined by the well-known binary value with the specified coordinate system identifier (SRID) (<xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography.DefaultCoordinateSystemId"></xref>).
Creates a new <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> line value based on the specified well-known text value and coordinate system identifier (SRID).
A string that contains a well-known text representation of the geography value.
The identifier of the coordinate system that the new <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value should use.

A new <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value as defined by the well-known text value with the specified coordinate system identifier (SRID) (<xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography.DefaultCoordinateSystemId"></xref>).
Creates a new <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> multiline value based on the specified well-known binary value and coordinate system identifier.
The well-known binary value.
The coordinate system identifier.
The new <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> multiline value.
Creates a new <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> multiline value based on the specified well-known text value and coordinate system identifier.
The well-known text value.
The coordinate system identifier.
A new <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> multiline value.

The well-known binary value.
The coordinate system identifier.
A new <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> multipoint value.

A new <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> multipoint value.

The coordinate system identifier.
A new <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> multi polygon value.

Returns a nullable double value that indicates the area of the given <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value, which may be null if the value does not represent a surface.
The geography value, which need not represent a surface.
A nullable double value that indicates the area of the given <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value.
Returns a nullable double value that indicates the area of the given <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeometry"></xref> value, which may be null if the value does not represent a surface.
The geometry value, which need not represent a surface.
A nullable double value that indicates the area of the given <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeometry"></xref> value.
Returns a nullable double value that indicates the boundary of the given <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value.
The geometry value.
The boundary of the given <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value.
Returns a <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeometry"></xref> value that represents the centroid of the given DbGeometry value, which may be null if the value does not represent a surface.
The geometry value, which need not represent a surface.
The centroid of geometryValue, if it represents a surface; otherwise `null`.
Returns a nullable double value that indicates the convex hull of the given <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value.

Returns the coordinate system identifier of the given <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value.

Gets the dimension of the given <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value or, if the value is a collections, the largest element dimension.
The geography value for which the dimension value should be retrieved.

Returns the number of elements in the given <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeometry"></xref> value, if it represents a geometry collection.
The geometry value, which need not represent a geometry collection.
The number of elements in geometryValue, if it represents a collection of other geometry values; otherwise `null`.

The geography value, which need not represent a geography collection.
The number of elements in geographyValue, if it represents a collection of other geography values; otherwise `null`.

The geography value, which need not represent a point.
The elevation (Z coordinate) of geographyValue, if it represents a point; otherwise `null`.

Returns a <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value that represents the end point of the given DbGeography value, which may be null if the value does not represent a curve.
The geography value, which need not represent a curve.
The end point of geographyValue, if it represents a curve; otherwise `null`.

The envelope of geometryValue, as a value.
Returns a <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeometry"></xref> value that represents the exterior ring of the given DbGeometry value, which may be null if the value does not represent a polygon.
The geometry value, which need not represent a polygon.

Returns the number of interior rings in the given <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeometry"></xref> value, if it represents a polygon.
The geometry value, which need not represent a polygon.
The number of elements in geometryValue, if it represents a polygon; otherwise `null`.
Returns a nullable Boolean value that whether the given <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value is closed, which may be null if the value does not represent a curve.
The geography value, which need not represent a curve.
`true` if the given <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value is closed; otherwise, `false`.
Returns a nullable Boolean value that whether the given <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeometry"></xref> value is closed, which may be null if the value does not represent a curve.

`true` if the given <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value is closed; otherwise, `false`.

`true` if the given <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value is empty; otherwise, `false`.

geometryValue

The geometry value, which need not represent a polygon.
The position within the geometry value from which the element should be taken.
The interior ring in geometryValue at position index, if it represents a polygon; otherwise `null`.
Computes the intersection of two <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeometry"></xref> values.
The first geometry value.
The second geometry value.
A new value representing the intersection of geometryValue and otherGeometry.
Computes the intersection of two <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> values.
The first geography value.
The second geography value.
A new value representing the intersection of geographyValue and otherGeography.
Determines whether the two given <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> values spatially intersect.
The first geography value to compare for intersection.
The second geography value to compare for intersection.
`true` if geographyValue intersects otherGeography; otherwise `false`.
Determines whether the two given <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeometry"></xref> values spatially intersect.
The first geometry value to compare for intersection.
The second geometry value to compare for intersection.
`true` if geometryValue intersects otherGeometry; otherwise `false`.
Determines whether the two given <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeometry"></xref> values spatially overlap.
The first geometry value.
The second geometry value.
`true` if geometryValue overlaps otherGeometry; otherwise `false`.
Returns a point element of the given <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> value, if it represents a linestring or linear ring.
The geography value, which need not represent a linestring or linear ring.
The position within the geography value from which the element should be taken.
The point in geographyValue at position index, if it represents a linestring or linear ring; otherwise `null`.
Returns a point element of the given <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeometry"></xref> value, if it represents a linestring or linear ring.
The geometry value, which need not represent a linestring or linear ring.
The position within the geometry value from which the element should be taken.
The point in geometryValue at position index, if it represents a linestring or linear ring; otherwise `null`.

Determines whether the two given <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeometry"></xref> values are spatially related according to the given Dimensionally Extended Nine-Intersection Model (DE-9IM) intersection pattern.
The first geometry value.
The geometry value that should be compared with the first geometry value for relation.
A string that contains the text representation of the (DE-9IM) intersection pattern that defines the relation.
`true` if this geometryValue value relates to otherGeometry according to the specified intersection pattern matrix; otherwise `false`.
Determines whether the two given <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> values are spatially equal.
The first geography value to compare for equality.
The second geography value to compare for equality.
`true` if geographyValue is spatially equal to otherGeography; otherwise `false`.
Determines whether the two given <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeometry"></xref> values are spatially equal.
The first geometry value to compare for equality.
The second geometry value to compare for equality.
`true` if geometryValue is spatially equal to otherGeometry; otherwise `false`.
Computes the symmetric difference of two <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> values.
The first geography value.
The second geography value.
A new value representing the symmetric difference of geographyValue and otherGeography.
Computes the symmetric difference between two <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeometry"></xref> values.
The first geometry value.
The second geometry value.
A new value representing the symmetric difference between geometryValue and otherGeometry.
Determines whether the two given <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeometry"></xref> values spatially touch.
The first geometry value.
The second geometry value.
`true` if geometryValue touches otherGeometry; otherwise `false`.
Computes the union of two <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeography"></xref> values.
The first geography value.
The second geography value.
A new value representing the union of geographyValue and otherGeography.
Computes the union of two <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeometry"></xref> values.
The first geometry value.
The second geometry value.
A new value representing the union of geometryValue and otherGeometry.
Determines whether one <xref href="System.Data.Spatial.DbGeometry"></xref> value is spatially within the other.
The first geometry value.
The second geometry value.
`true` if geometryValue is within otherGeometry; otherwise `false`.
